name: places/ChIJLUoAa-EHZkARkQN60zR6JvA
formattedAddress: 159 E 103rd St, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 159 E 103rd St, New York, NY 10029, USA

editorialSummary.text: Longtime outfit specializing in custom cakes with a variety of fillings plus ready-made options.

originalText.text: For the past couple of years I have been getting my favorite cake for my birthday, traditional Valencia cake with pineapple filling.  I will not go anywhere else as long as they are in business.  The cake is moist, the pineapple is fresh, and the frosting is perfect I'm taste and consistency.  And I would be remiss if I didn't mention the beautiful decorations.  I order my cake online this year, which was very convenient.  I also consider their prices to be reasonable given the high quality of their creations. Highly recommend.

originalText.text: This really disappointed me!! My friend took me to buy a bday cake for me as these are cakes that have been around for a long time. Thing is we took it back to the house, had one slice and threw the rest out! It was terrible!! Old, stale and dry! We called up to complain, but to return the cake to get our money back was out of the Pic. I was on a bday vacation leaving in the early morning.

originalText.text: Valecia cakes used to be alot better many years ago. When we were growing up my dad use to bring home a cake at the time they where five dollars and the location was 115 st Manhattan. . The cakes used to be so moist. Delicious.  And now I don't know if the recipe was change but the cakes I have bought at 103rd Manhattan.  They taste dry and not the moisture they used to have. Maybe their cakes are old . Valencia was our favorite cakes. Used them for all our special occasions.  Birthdays. Christianity.  Engagements.Wedding. Holiday parties. Even Sundays Family Gatherings. I hoping they will get the old recipe back. And another thing they have gotten extremely expensive. So is the ice cream.

originalText.text: I was very disappointed the cakes were rancid. The pineapple was bad. I travel from Pennsylvania to get these cakes in New York City. And I was disappointed this is. One of my favorite cakes. We spent at least a $125 on cakes to be thrown out in the garbage I hope.  That you read this post and take it into consideration to change what you're doing. Because what you're doing now is not working and it's a shame that this is a 100 year company or more and something changed the cakes were awful.

originalText.text: I recently had the pleasure of visiting Valencia Bakery over the weekend, and I cannot speak highly enough about the exceptional customer service I received from Chris. From the moment I walked through the door, Chris's dedication, professionalism, and genuine warmth made my visit truly memorable.  Their friendly nature, deep knowledge, and dedication to providing an exceptional experience left a lasting impression on me. I wholeheartedly recommend Chris and Valencia Bakery to anyone seeking not only delicious treats but also a remarkable customer service experience. They truly embody the essence of outstanding service and are a valuable asset to the bakery. While the customer service was exceptional, I found the cake to be slightly dry. However, it is important to note that despite this minor flaw, the flavor and quality of the cake were still enjoyable and it did not overshadow the positive aspects of my experience at Valencia Bakery. I would gladly return for their exceptional customer service and the overall quality of their products.
